alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Middlesex and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 PM EDT, emergency management reports NJ 91 near Huron Rd in North Brunswick, Middlesex County remains closed in both directions due to flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Raritan and Sandy Hook-Staten Island. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, North Brunswick Township, Society Hill, Dayton, Kendall Park, South Plainfield, and South River. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 10 and 11. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
